result.execSummary:
The defendant Stephanie A Vetter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Huber with standard release conditions. 
Sentence credit of 5 days is granted.

miscConds.notes:
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.  
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 5, 2022 at 11:00 am.

09:15 AM; Case called for Plea hearing.  Defendant Stephanie A Vetter in court with attorney Ricardo Tapia.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Julian Marrufo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  atty. Tapia provides an update, he was hopeful to proceed on a DPA today but that is not possible.  Atty. Tapia is requesting new plea and sentencing date.  Court adjourns for plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Plea hearing on June 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.

10:54 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Stephanie A Vetter in court by Zoom video means with attorney Ricardo Tapia.  Patrick Ryan Campbell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.  Atty. Tapia requests the matter be set for a DPA plea hearing in about 30 days.  Court adjourns for plea hearing on a DPA.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Filed by Atty. Tapia requesting permission for the defendant to appear by Zoom for the 5/25/2022 hearing.    ** Reviewed by Judge Lau on 5/18/22 - Request granted.**

**Clerk's office to notify Atty. Tapia to provide the Zoom information to his client.** (am)
Hearing on May 25, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

09:25 AM Defendant Stephanie A Vetter in court with attorney Ricardo Tapia.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 10:30 am.

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on April 18, 2022 at 09:15 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.

01:32 PM Defendant Stephanie A Vetter in court, in custody, with attorney Ricardo Tapia.   Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 09:15 am.
